sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A most excelent and fruitful treatise, called Patericks Places concerning the doctrine of fayth, and the doctrine of the law: which being knowen, you haue the pith of all diuinitie. With a briefe collection or exposition of a summe of S. Pauls doctrine touching iustification by fayth, in Iesus Christ: which is the only marke to shoote at, and the only meanes to obtaine saluation. Selected and reduced into this volume by I.D. 1598. Patrick's Places. English Hamilton, Patrick, 1504?-1528. Frith, John, 1503-1533. I. D.
[4], 30 leaves
Printed by William White dwelling in Cow-lane neare Holborne Condite, and are there to be solde, At London : 1598.
The author's name, Patrick Hamilton, appears on *3v. A revised and expanded edition of the translation from Latin of "Patrick's Places" by John Frith. Editor's preface signed: I.D. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
A most excelent and fruitful treatise, called Patericks Places concerning the doctrine of fayth, and the doctrine of the law: which being knowen, you haue the pith of all diuinitie. With a briefe collection or exposition of a summe of S. Pauls doctrine touching iustification by fayth, in Iesus Christ: which is the only marke to shoote at, and the only meanes to obtaine saluation. Selected and reduced into this volume by I.D. 1598. Patrick's Places. English Hamilton, Patrick, 1504?-1528. Frith, John, 1503-1533. I. D.
[4], 30 leaves
Printed by William White dwelling in Cow-lane neare Holborne Condite, and are there to be solde, At London : 1598.
The author's name, Patrick Hamilton, appears on *3v. A revised and expanded edition of the translation from Latin of "Patrick's Places" by John Frith. Editor's preface signed: I.D. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
